intro: Meum pyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean meadowfoam, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are white or pale yellow, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Meum pyrenaicum is adapted to rocky and alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
